H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2261.def: = bright golden yellow flower, growing with several flowers on one stem; ◄ Narcissus tazetta; ≈ symbol of beauty

H8289.def: = plain; ◄ along the coast of the Mediterranean

H7799.def: = a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone-shaped flowers, usually with 5-6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty

= a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone-shaped flowers, usually with 5-6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H2336.def: = plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless

H7474.def: = female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H8598.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-10 meters; it has a rounded crown, and bears a round fruit about the size of an orange; in the spring the tree is completely covered with pink flowers, which gradually give way to the green of the leaves as they develop; the fruit can be greenish, yellow, or red. ◄ Malus sylvestris; ► considered both beautiful and refreshing

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H2530.def: = process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H4966.def: = state in which food tastes well

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H1714.def: = piece of cloth that is raised on a pole; ► symbolizes the identity of a group of people, and helps to keep the group together; ≈ associated with security

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H5564.def: = action by which humans put their hand(s) on another human, an animal, or an object ► often as a ritual before sacrifice or a sign of authority or punishment

H809.def: = cake; ◄ made of dried, compressed grapes; ► possibly eaten at festivals and other special ceremonies

H8598.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-10 meters; it has a rounded crown, and bears a round fruit about the size of an orange; in the spring the tree is completely covered with pink flowers, which gradually give way to the green of the leaves as they develop; the fruit can be greenish, yellow, or red. ◄ Malus sylvestris; ► considered both beautiful and refreshing

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H1801.def: = action by which someone puts one leg in front of the other in order to move forward, with the specific intention to avoid touching an object that is located under one's feet

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7092.def: literally: to close part of one's body; hence: = to stop engaging part of one's body ► in order to stop performing a certain action

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H6082.def: = a young male {L:fallow deer<SDBH:אַיָּל>}; ≈ associated with beauty

H354.def: = wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3796.def: = flat vertical construction, ◄ made of stone, sometimes with wooden supports, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space

H7688.def: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes on an object for a prolonged period of time

H2474.def: = an opening ◄ in the wall of a building, ► which admits light and often air to a room and allows its occupants to look out, or objects within to be seen; in some cases they can be opened and closed; sometimes used as secret entrance or exit; ≈ has therefore some connonations of secrecy

H6692.def: = process by which a plant produces flowers in the spring as a precursor to the plant's fruit; ≈ associated with strength, prosperity, and splendor

H2762.def: = structure of cross laths with interstices ◄ in a door or window

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7474.def: = female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3303.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye

H1653.def: = water that has fallen as rain

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5339.def: = flowers on a tree or bush

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H2159.def: = action by which one expresses utters words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H8449.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H6291.def: = fruit of the {L:fig<SDBH:תְּאֵנָה>} tree, of the variety that ripens early (in June); ► appreciated because of their fine flavor

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H7381.def: = a distinctive smell, which can be perceived as either pleasant or unpleasant; ≈ sometimes associated with the attitude a certain smell evokes in those who perceive it

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7474.def: = female person who has a special and intimate relationship with another person

H3303.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans, animals, or objects is pleasing to the eye

H3123.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H2288.def: = area that is difficult to reach, ◄ located within mountains or rocks, ► which people may use as a temporary or permanent dwelling-place; ≈ and is regarded as relatively safe

H4095.def: = a steep or vertical rock face

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4758.def: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye

H6156.def: = state in which food tastes well and is considered desirable food; can be extended to refer to other things besides food

H5000.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H7776.def: = animal that looks like a longhaired dog with a pointed nose and a bushy tail; either reddish with white underparts (fox) or yellowish brown with red tips to the fur on the back (jackal); scavenger; ≈ associated with destruction and devastation, and also with being insignificant but self-important

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H7799.def: = a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone-shaped flowers, usually with 5-6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6315.def: = causative action by which deities or forces cause air to blow from one place to another

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H6082.def: = a young male {L:fallow deer<SDBH:אַיָּל>}; ≈ associated with beauty

H354.def: = wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H1336.def: = one part of an object that has been divided an object into two halves

6.gl: a breeze starts blowing at the end of the day
